Description: Earring with pearl pendant: An earring consisting of small hoops closing in front with a hook-and-loop fastening which is partially concealed by an applied, small, domed disc. Hanging from each hoop is a gold wire with its upper part covered by spiral coiling, supporting a small baroque pearl.
Curator's comments: Pair with 1872.0604.1494. The construction and embellishment of the hoop is very close to Stefanelli 1992, figs 176 and 177, two pairs of earrings from a second-century grave group from Rome; these do not, however, have pendants. L. Stefanelli, 'L'Oro dei Romani, gioielli di età imperiale' (1992), fig. 176 & 177; F. H. Marshall, ‘Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum’ (1911), no. 2540; S. Walker, 'Ancient Faces', New York 2000, p. 153 [108].
